description: From zoo- +‎ (itself from Ancient Greek ζῷον (zôion, “animal”)) + Ancient Greek νόσος (nósos, “disease”) (compare also nosology); the surface analysis is almost, although not quite, zoo- +‎ -osis; compare also anthroponosis.

entries.meaning: (biology, microbiology) An animal disease, such as rabies or anthrax, that can be transmitted to humans.
